the plap in th high five might be the best part cause that’s the exact sound bare boob makes
Hi there Spazz
Hi Quill
Hi SonOfGoku
Howdy howdy howdy everyone :ptv-greetings:
Hiya Aspiring
Yesterday I had my first "I don't want to deal with people today" day
It faded about halfway through my shift, but yay for forced human contact jobs~
Sheesh
I feel ya
TBH, I don't think it was entirely that
It was, "I don't want to have to do the checklist AND deal with customers" day
Btw, hate that effing checklist.  It's so freaking outdated
It's basically a list of "do this, do that, do it every shift every day, with some exceptions for third since we don't really want them going outside"
But... not everything NEEDS done on every shift, not unless you want to waste time and/or resources.
And some stuff isn't a once and done, it should be done constantly throughout the shift.
This place is slowly grinding my gears :ptv-unimpressed:
With me, I just don't have enough time on my shift to do everything I need, and I sometimes stay over the end (and no overtime).
So you work off the clock?
My manager is looking to get my shift extended by 1/2 an hour so that I'm not under so much pressure
We use a clock in machine
But are only paid as per our shift
And if you can't finish your stuff before leaving you get written up / penaltied?
No, I just don't get paid for the time I spent finishing up
I'm generally on my own after 6:00pm in the kitchen
Okay, that's not so bad then
My shift ends at 7:30, but it can and often does take longer to finish the dishes, empty the last few bins, shine the sinks, drain the dishwasher....
I was about to go "That reeks of federal labor law violations"
I should mention that I only work 3 days a week at this place now
Not sure if I should be happy or upset that the days are spread out
Normal person schedule: I work Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday
Weird place schedule: I work Saturday, Tuesday, Thursday
Okay...aren't those the same days though?
yes, but our schedule starts on friday :P
Because weekends are meaningless, lol
Aaaah.
Like I said, don't know whether to be happy or upset about the fact that all the days I work are spread out
Part of me is like, "YEAH, A DAY OFF AFTER EACH SHIFT!"
The other is like, "Bleh, just group 'em all together and let me enjoy a super long weekend"
I find myself better with the latter option.
I'm gonna talk with my 2nd boss
As it stands, I update the app twice a month on the 15th and final days
Oh I see
Part of the reason is that the app was ignoring start dates on the coupons.  But if that was fixed up, then I don't need to reserve those days
That's good here.
And if I don't have this super weird availability, then maybe my days will get clustered together
It is nicer overall to have a cluster of days together.,
I would probably agree with that statement
What I believe is best above all is consistency
This job doesn't schedule out more than a week in advance.  So at best you'll know what next week's schedule is once the current week starts
My schedule is kind of hard to get too
But ofc, company policy is that they want 3 weeks notice for any requests :P
The manager's trying to get a roster for the next fortnight
I feel like part of the reason a lot of jobs are so horrible is that they are somewhat unreasonable in terms of a long-term job / career
Who wants to make a career where your days / hours can change constantly, and you get almost no advance notice to changes?

That said, where I work is pretty decent about sticking to a schedule.  The only time a schedule changes is if there was a mistake and it violated someone's availability, but that's usually fixed in a day of being notified
Other than that, usual retail bs.  Someone didn't show or called off, so they see if anyone's available :P
I see
Another day in Paradise then
Also, pray for my manager.  Night guy didn't show last night, so he had to eat the 10 - 6
And today was supposed to be his day off xD
Consider a prayer sent-poor chap
It's funny, he was trying to get me out of there, and I was like, "After I finish checking the expirations on this last row."
I thought it was 11:15 or so, was actually 11:45 xD
yeah... once I start doing something, I will keep doing until I'm satisfied and can say "enough for now" :ptv-uneasy:
Not really the kind of temperament / personality for a job that is best described as for people with ADD, lol
Like me...
I just can't go on break until I've finished washing everything around me
I don't take breaks at work, lol
Which sucks because I don't take breaks unless there's nothing (at least to me) to do, and there's no customers.  And there are no assigned breaks
That sucks
Well
We are told we have at least a 1/2 hour per shift
1 hour for those with a 12 hour or longer
It's a shame, really
I'm clearly the only one checking the dates on stuff that lasts forever
Fresh case, don't need to worry too much
That's dedication
Baked goods?  If it's hand dated, same deal.
But stuff like chips, candy, and jerky?  Good fucking luck
Back in October, I cleaned the ENTIRE store of expired stuff
Found a tiny container of ranch that was dated for 5 - 7 months ago
Wheesh
Found a bag of sunflower seeds dated for DEC 2017
How long did it take?
Found a bunch of other stuff that expired anywhere from that month to the beginning of the year
3 - 4 shifts, taking up half my shift, and me giving the finger to the damned checklist
Good Go
God
Argh
Thanks to corporate cutting hours, I man the store solo for the last 1.5 - 2 hours
Painful!
On the bright side, checking dates is one of the few things I can do during that time
And go fucking figure, I've found stuff that expired in November of last year, lmao
"Huh, I wonder if anyone che- NOPE."
Not to mention people can't follow damned FIFO :ptv-uneasy:
I spend so much time just fixing the ordering of products ont he shelves :ptv-unimpressed:
I see that in shops all the time.
People take stuff from one place, but put it in another.
It hurts to see.
Oh yeah, I fixed that too! lol
People not paying attention to the product's size.  So they put large bags with small bags and vice-versa
I've come to learn that "productivity" is a euphemism for "do as much shit in as little time as possible"
Which ends up being shorthand for "quantity over quality"
A whirlwind of stress, in other words.
You know corporate
Always obsessed with profit
Want as much as possible
Don't want to pay for the quality needed to keep it there
I feel a rant incoming
Let's talk about something else
Otherwise I'll fill the chat with walls of text...
Oh, a rant from you? xD
Meh, it's the standard "we're not happy with making a lot of money we want to make ALL the money" schtick
That train of thought is working WONDERS for the games industry at the moment :ptv-snicker:

Seriously, What the FUCK is wrong with those people? They sit all so plush and pimp in their half-arsed GODAWFUL furniture in STUPIDLY OVERPRICED HOMES while ONE FUCKING STREET AWAY there are poor sods who haven't even got a sleeping bag for themselves,
Oh no, I've triggered a rant :ptv-shock:
Just a piece of cardboard, and it's TOO MUCH to think about sustainable jobs, OH NO! Not long and stable, it has to be all MONEY MONEY MONEY and then crash, MONEYU crash MONEY crash IT GOES ON AND ON
On the bright side, I've decided that this company isn't worth working for.
And of course, something works by providing actually decent customer service and good quality products/service/whatever? No, they can't be having that, can they, it's not making enough MONEY.
Look at how a company treats its managers, and you'll get a feel for what it's really like.
Money, power and sex. That's all they FUCKING CARE ABOUT.
I don't give a SHIT about their profit margins.
I don't give a rat's arse about "Investment"
Hehe, look at what happened to Home Depot
And I DESPISE THEIR OVERSIZED FLIPPING HOMES
SERIOUSLY
HOUSES THE SIZE OF FUCKING FOOTBALL FIELDS! While in the city centres there are FAMILIES Cramped in 2-up-2-down buildings
And of course I could go ON and ON about the environmental and cultural impact of it all here and in other countries...
AAARGH
Someone stop me before I break the chat...
vents some steam
Sorry.
stumbles blindly through this mysterious fog.
Sorry./
I just.
Really hate.
How shitty people can be.
Including myself.
Like I said, look at how a company treats its managers
My manager is salaried for about $48k a year
Doesn't seem so bad.
But they want him scheduled for a minimum of 48 hours a week.
Bullshit, that's what that is. Absolute bullshit and buggery.
(Pardon my language)
The new owners of the chain also eliminated the 3 month raise for new hires
Which i understand is pretty standard
I feel really sorry for whoever opens the chat and just sees a wall of swearing and ranting...
3 month raise?
At a lot of hourly positions it's pretty standard to give new employees a raise after 3 months of service
Since these positions also tend to be ones with very high turnover rates
I see
